title: ASH TRAINING DAY 4
description: Understanding price imbalances, Fair Value Gaps (FVG), and inefficient price movement.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What is imbalance in trading
• Fair Value Gap (FVG) definition and formation
• Why price returns to fill gaps
• How to identify valid FVG setups
• Using imbalance for structured trading
• The relationship between structure and inefficiency

quiz.question: What is imbalance in trading?
quiz.explanation: Imbalance occurs when there's inefficient price movement, creating gaps that price tends to revisit.

quiz.question: Fair Value Gap (FVG) represents:
quiz.explanation: FVG is an unfilled price zone created by inefficient price movement that traders often target.

quiz.question: Price often returns to FVG to:
quiz.explanation: Price is drawn back to FVG zones to rebalance the inefficiency that was created.

quiz.question: A valid FVG must:
quiz.explanation: A valid FVG must be in context with the current market structure to be a reliable trading level.

quiz.question: Imbalance trading focuses on:
quiz.explanation: Effective imbalance trading combines structural analysis with identification of inefficient gaps.
